intro: Aphanopappus micranthus, commonly known as the small-headed fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Aphanopappus micranthus is known for its low-growing habit and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
